section.title: Configuring the SystemBuilder Machine
section.para: SystemBuilder is designed to work in a networked environment. You can install SystemBuilder on a Linux system operating with Fedora 10, CentOS 5 or Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5. The OS needs to include an http daemon with the ability to host web-accessible appliances for download. If you're using Apache, the httpd configuration file directive <Directory> specifies the location of the default directory for http files.

For capacity planning purposes, the machine should have a separate logical or physical drive for the /var directory. SystemBuilder uses the /var/cache directory during initial and subsequent appliance builds and the /var/www/html directory for hosting the appliances for distribution. Consequently, the drive space allocated should be a minimum of 30GB. Depending upon the number and size of the applications included in the appliance, you may need more disk space.

Disk access is another consideration. Due to the size of the files handled, fast disk access is preferable. To accommodate the speed requirements, it is best to use hard disk drives with Serial Advanced Technology Attachment (SATA) interfaces.

In addition to the SystemBuilder product, the SystemBuilder build system must have a web server installed on it in order to distribute the appliance through the network. For instructions on installing SystemBuilder and a web server and verifying that SystemBuilder is running correctly, see the "Getting Started Guide" on Rendition Software's web site.
Now you are ready to begin defining your appliance!
